feed.title: Google Cloud: Cloud Run
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Cloud Run

entry.content: You can deploy services to Cloud Run using a Compose file (Preview).
entry.summary: You can now deploy services to Cloud Run using a Compose file (Preview). This simplifies the deployment process for your services.
entry.title: Feature: Deploy to Cloud Run with Compose

entry.content: Cloud Run source deployment supports Ubuntu 24 LTS base images (Preview). This builder is available under gcr.io/buildpacks/builder:google-24. For more information, see Builders.
entry.summary: Cloud Run has introduced support for Ubuntu 24 LTS base images in preview. This new builder, available at gcr.io/buildpacks/builder:google-24, enhances deployment options for your applications.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run now supports Ubuntu 24 LTS base images

entry.content: Support for Python 3.14 runtime is in Preview. Starting from Python version 3.14 and later, the Python buildpack uses the UV package manager as the default installer for the dependencies you specify in your requirements.txt file. You can also use pip as the default installer for these versions by setting the GOOGLE_PYTHON_PACKAGE_MANAGER environment variable to pip. For more information, see Specify dependencies in Python.
entry.summary: Google Cloud Run now supports Python 3.14 in preview. This update includes the UV package manager as the default for dependency installation, with an option to switch back to pip.
entry.title: Feature: Python 3.14 runtime now in Preview

entry.content: You can set a task timeout up to 168 hours (7 days) for Cloud Run jobs. (GA)
entry.summary: You can now set a task timeout of up to 168 hours for Cloud Run jobs.
entry.title: Feature: Task timeout for Cloud Run jobs

entry.content: Use dual-stack subnets with IPv6 to let your Cloud Run resources send IPv4 and internal IPv6 traffic to a VPC network with Direct VPC egress, and send external IPv6 traffic to the public internet. (GA)
entry.summary: Cloud Run now supports dual-stack subnets with IPv6, enabling both IPv4 and internal IPv6 traffic to VPC networks with Direct VPC egress, as well as external IPv6 traffic to the internet.
entry.title: Feature: Dual-stack subnets with IPv6

entry.content: Support for Java 25 runtime is in Preview.
entry.summary: We're excited to announce that support for the Java 25 runtime is now available in preview. This update allows you to leverage the latest features and improvements in the Java ecosystem for your Cloud Run applications. Explore the new runtime and provide your feedback as we continue to enhance our services.
entry.title: Feature: Java 25 Runtime Now in Preview

entry.content: For Cloud Run source deployed services and functions with GPU enabled, Cloud Run defaults to using Cloud Build's e2-highcpu-8 machine type for the build process when using the gcloud CLI or the Google Cloud console. This change allows for higher CPU support and faster build times, and also leads to a moderate increase in the overall cost of your service (GA).
entry.summary: Cloud Run now uses a higher CPU machine type for builds on GPU-enabled services, leading to faster build times.
entry.title: Feature: GPU support for Cloud Run builds

entry.content: Support for configuring GPU for your Cloud Run job is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: You can now configure GPUs for your Cloud Run jobs, as this feature has reached General Availability. This allows for more powerful processing capabilities for your batch workloads.
entry.title: Feature: GPU support for Cloud Run jobs now in GA

entry.content: Direct VPC egress now supports Private NAT (GA).
entry.summary: Direct VPC egress now supports Private NAT, offering enhanced connectivity options.
entry.title: Feature: Direct VPC egress now supports Private NAT

entry.content: Direct VPC egress now supports VPC Flow Logs (Preview).
entry.summary: Direct VPC egress now supports VPC Flow Logs (Preview).
entry.title: Feature: VPC Flow Logs Support for Direct VPC Egress

entry.content: Support for applying maximum instance configuration at the service level is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: You can now set the maximum instance configuration at the service level for Google Cloud Run, which is now in General Availability. This feature allows for better control over resource allocation.
entry.title: Feature: Maximum instance configuration now available at service level

entry.content: Support for setting multiple environment variables using the .env file is in General Availability (GA). For more information, see Configure environment variables for services, jobs, and worker pools.
entry.summary: You can now set multiple environment variables using a .env file for Cloud Run services, jobs, and worker pools. This feature is now in General Availability.
entry.title: Feature: Multiple environment variables now supported

entry.content: You can specify mount options when you configure Cloud Storage volume mounts for Cloud Run services, jobs, and worker pools. (GA)
entry.summary: You can now specify mount options when configuring Cloud Storage volume mounts for Cloud Run services, jobs, and worker pools.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run volume mounts now support mount options

entry.content: You can deploy and configure a multi-region service from a single gcloud CLI command or by using a YAML or Terraform file (GA).
entry.summary: Deploy and configure a multi-region service using a single gcloud CLI command or YAML/Terraform files.
entry.title: Feature: Deploy multi-region service

entry.content: Cloud Run Threat Detection is available in General Availability.
entry.summary: Cloud Run Threat Detection is now available in General Availability. This feature helps secure your Cloud Run services.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run Threat Detection Now Generally Available

entry.content: You can configure GPU in your Cloud Run worker pool (Preview).
entry.summary: You can now configure GPUs in your Cloud Run worker pools. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: GPU support in Cloud Run worker pools

entry.content: Support for Go 1.25 runtime is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: Go 1.25 runtime now available.
entry.title: Feature: Go 1.25 runtime now available on Cloud Run

entry.content: For Cloud Run source deployed services and functions with GPU enabled, Cloud Run defaults to using Cloud Build's e2-highcpu-8 machine type for the build process when you use the gcloud beta run command (Preview). This change allows for higher CPU support and faster build times, and also leads to a moderate increase in the overall cost of your service.
entry.summary: Cloud Run now uses e2-highcpu-8 for GPU builds with gcloud beta run.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run GPU Build Enhancement

entry.content:
The Python buildpack supports Cloud Run source deployments for modern web frameworks such as FastAPI, Gradio, and Streamlit.

For Python version 3.13 and later, the Python buildpack sets the default entrypoint for Cloud Run source deployments based on the web server or framework configuration in your requirements.txt file. For more information, see Build a Python application.
entry.summary: New buildpack for Python supports Cloud Run source deployments with modern web frameworks.
entry.title: Feature: Python Buildpack Update

entry.content: You can set multiple environment variables using the .env file (Preview). For more information, see Configure environment variables for services, jobs, and worker pools.
entry.summary: Set multiple environment variables using the .env file.
entry.title: Feature: New feature: Set multiple environment variables

entry.content: Support for manually scaling your Cloud Run service is now at General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: Manually scale your Cloud Run service.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run Manual Scaling GA

entry.content: Support for Go 1.24 runtime is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: Go 1.24 runtime now available.
entry.title: Feature: Go 1.24 runtime now available

entry.content: Support for Go 1.25 runtime is in Preview. This runtime is available for early testers using existing release candidates.
entry.summary: Go 1.25 runtime now in preview. Early testers can use existing release candidates.
entry.title: Feature: Go 1.25 runtime now in preview

entry.content: Support for Node.js 24 runtime is in Preview. Node.js 24 is in the Current release state and enters long-term support (LTS) in October 2025. For more information, see Node.js v24.0.0 (Current) in the Node.js website.
entry.summary: Node.js 24 runtime now in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Node.js 24 runtime now available

entry.content: You can disable the built-in run.app URL of a Cloud Run service to ensure that traffic can only ingress through paths that you've explicitly configured (GA).
entry.summary: You can now disable the built-in `run.app` URL for your Cloud Run services. This allows you to control traffic ingress more granularly, ensuring it only passes through your configured paths. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run: Disable built-in `run.app` URL

entry.content:
Compute flexible committed use discounts (CUDs) have expanded to also cover your Cloud Billing account's spend across Cloud Run services with request-based billing and Cloud Run functions.

The improved spend-based CUD experience is available without requiring an opt-in for new users or users who don't have an active spend-based CUD.

To learn more about how opting into the new model affects your flexible CUDs, see Committed use discounts.
entry.summary: You can now use flexible committed use discounts to cover your Cloud Billing account's spend on Cloud Run services with request-based billing and Cloud Run functions. This feature is automatically available for new users and those without active spend-based CUDs.
entry.title: Feature: Flexible CUDs now cover Cloud Run

entry.content: Support for the Go 1.24 runtime is in Preview.
entry.summary: Google Cloud Run now supports the Go 1.24 runtime in preview. This update allows developers to leverage the latest features and improvements in the Go programming language for their serverless applications.
entry.title: Feature: Go 1.24 runtime support in preview

entry.content: You can apply maximum instance configuration at the service level (in Preview).
entry.summary: You can now set the maximum instance configuration at the service level. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Maximum instance configuration at service level

entry.content: Cloud Run worker pools are now available (Preview). Worker pools are specifically designed for non-request workloads.
entry.summary: Cloud Run worker pools are now available in preview. This feature is designed for non-request driven workloads.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Run worker pools now available in preview

entry.content: A new region is now available for Cloud Run GPUs: us-east4.
entry.summary: A new region, us-east4, is now available for Cloud Run GPUs.
entry.title: Feature: New region available for Cloud Run GPUs

entry.content: Support for the PHP 8.4 runtime is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: PHP 8.4 runtime is now generally available on Google Cloud Run, offering enhanced features and performance for your applications.
entry.title: Feature: PHP 8.4 runtime now available on Cloud Run

entry.content: Support for the Ruby 3.4 runtime is in General Availability (GA).
entry.summary: Ruby 3.4 runtime is now generally available in Google Cloud Run, offering improved performance and features.
entry.title: Feature: Ruby 3.4 runtime now available

entry.content: You can configure GPU in your Cloud Run job (Preview).
entry.summary: You can now configure GPUs in your Cloud Run jobs to run even more demanding workloads.
entry.title: Feature: Configure GPU in Cloud Run Jobs

entry.content: You can use request host and request path in IAM Conditions when defining access control for invoking Cloud Run services.
entry.summary: You can now use request host and request path in IAM Conditions to manage access control for your Cloud Run services. This provides more granular control over who can invoke your services.
entry.title: Feature: IAM Conditions for Cloud Run

entry.content: For Java Cloud Run functions that use functions-framework version 1.4.0 or later, you can now use the logging class java.util.logging.Logger to add a unique execution ID to log outputs.
entry.summary: You can now add a unique execution ID to your Java Cloud Run function logs using the `java.util.logging.Logger` class. This feature is available for functions using `functions-framework` version 1.4.0 and later.
entry.title: Feature: Execution ID logging for Java Cloud Run

entry.content: Multiple regions now benefit from enhanced responsiveness for latency-sensitive applications for Cloud Run service URLs.
entry.summary: Latency-sensitive applications using Cloud Run service URLs now have improved responsiveness across multiple regions.
entry.title: Feature: Enhanced Responsiveness for Cloud Run Service URLs
